pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa upaṭṭhākakulaṃ āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ bhattena nimantesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.2.eng: a family that was supporting Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had invited him to a meal,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.3.eng: and they had invited other monks too.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto purebhattaṃ, kulāni payirupāsati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.4.eng: But since Upananda was visiting other families before that meal,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te manusse etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.5.eng: the other monks said to that family,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.7.eng: “Please wait, sirs, until Venerable Upananda arrives.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.9.pli: tatiyampi kho te bhikkhū te manusse etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.9.eng: A third time those monks said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.10.eng: “Please give the meal before it is too late.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.11.pli: “Yampi mayaṃ, bhante, bhattaṃ karimhā ayyassa upanandassa kāraṇā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.11.eng: “But we prepared the meal because of Venerable Upananda.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.13.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto purebhattaṃ kulāni payirupāsitvā divā āgacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.13.eng: Then, after visiting those families, Upananda arrived late,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.14.eng: and those monks did not eat as much as they had intended.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.15.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.15.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.16.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto nimantito sabhatto samāno purebhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.16.eng: “How can Venerable Upananda visit families first when invited to a meal?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.17.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, nimantito sabhatto samāno purebhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.17.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.20.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, nimantito sabhatto samāno purebhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.20.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.22.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.22.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.23.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu nimantito sabhatto samāno purebhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.23.1.eng: ‘If a monk who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.24.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.24.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa upaṭṭhākakulaṃ saṅghassatthāya khādanīyaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a family that was supporting Upananda sent fresh food to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.2.eng: They instructed that the food should be shown to Upananda and then given to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto gāmaṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭho hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.3.eng: But on that occasion Upananda had gone to the village for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.4.pli: Atha kho te manussā ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhū pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.4.eng: When those people arrived at the monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.6.pli: “Esāvuso, āyasmā upanando sakyaputto gāmaṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭho”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.6.eng: and they were told where he was.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.7.pli: “Idaṃ, bhante, khādanīyaṃ ayyassa upanandassa dassetvā saṅghassa dātabban”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.7.eng: They said, “Venerables, after showing it to Venerable Upananda, this fresh food is to be given to the Sangha.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.9.eng: who then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.10.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, paṭiggahetvā nikkhipatha yāva upanando āgacchatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.10.eng: “Well then, monks, receive it and put it aside until Upananda returns.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.11.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto—“bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ purebhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjitun”ti pacchābhattaṃ kulāni payirupāsitvā divā paṭikkami, khādanīyaṃ ussāriyittha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.11.eng: When he heard that the Buddha had prohibited visiting families before the meal, Upananda visited them after the meal instead. As a consequence, he returned late to the monastery, and the food had to be returned to the donors.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.12.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.12.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto pacchābhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.13.eng: “How can Venerable Upananda visit families after the meal?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, pacchābhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.14.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.17.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, pacchābhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.17.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.19.eng: “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.20.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu nimantito sabhatto samāno purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.20.1.eng: ‘If a monk who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand or afterwards, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.21.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.21.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū cīvaradānasamaye kukkuccāyantā kulāni na payirupāsanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.1.eng: Soon afterwards it was the robe-giving season. But being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not visit families.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.2.eng: As a result, they only got a small amount of robe-cloth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.4.eng: “Monks, I allow you to visit families during the robe-giving season.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.5.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.5.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.6.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu nimantito sabhatto samāno purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.6.1.eng: ‘If a monk who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand or afterwards, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.7.eng: This is the appropriate occasion: it is the robe-giving season.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.8.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.8.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū cīvarakammaṃ karonti, attho ca hoti sūciyāpi suttenapi satthakenapi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks were making robes, and they needed a needle, thread, and scissors.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.2.eng: But being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not visit families.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.4.eng: “Monks, I allow you to visit families at a time of making robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.5.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.5.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.6.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu nimantito sabhatto samāno purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.6.1.eng: ‘If a monk who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand or afterwards, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.7.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.7.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.8.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.8.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū gilānā honti, attho ca hoti bhesajjehi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.1.eng: Soon afterwards there were sick monks who needed medicines.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.2.eng: But being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not visit families.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.4.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, santaṃ bhikkhuṃ āpucchā kulāni payirupāsituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.4.eng: “Monks, I allow you to visit families after informing an available monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.5.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.5.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.6.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu nimantito sabhatto samāno santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.6.1.eng: ‘If a monk who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand or afterwards without informing an available monk, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.7.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.7.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.6.eng: invited to eat any of the five cooked foods.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.10.eng: he is able to inform and then enter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.12.eng: he is not able to inform and then enter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.14.eng: he has not yet eaten what he has been invited to eat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.16.pli: yena nimantito taṃ antamaso kusaggenapi bhuttaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.16.eng: even if he has just eaten what fits on the tip of a blade of grass from what he has been invited to eat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.18.pli: cattāri kulāni— khattiyakulaṃ, brāhmaṇakulaṃ, vessakulaṃ, suddakulaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.18.eng: there are four kinds of families: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.20.eng: if he enters the vicinity of someone else’s house, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.21.pli: Paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ ummāraṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.21.eng: If he crosses the threshold with the first foot, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.22.eng: If he crosses the threshold with the second foot, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.24.eng: unless it is an appropriate occasion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.26.pli: anatthate kathine vassānassa pacchimo māso, atthate kathine pañca māsā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.26.eng: for one who has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is the last month of the rainy season. For one who has participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is the five-month period.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.26.comm: “Robe-making ceremony” refers to the kathina saṅghakamma, the making of the kathina robe, and the rejoicing in the process, all three together represented by the words (an)atthate kathine . “The five month period” is the last month of the rainy season plus the four months of the cold season. See also kathina in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.1.27.eng: It is a time of making robes:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.2.1.pli: Nimantite nimantitasaññī santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjati, aññatra samayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.2.1.eng: If he has been invited, and he perceives that he has, and he visits families beforehand or afterwards without informing an available monk, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.2.2.pli: Nimantite vematiko santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjati, aññatra samayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.2.2.eng: If he has been invited, but he is unsure of it, and he visits families beforehand or afterwards without informing an available monk, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.2.3.pli: Nimantite animantitasaññī santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjati, aññatra samayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.2.3.eng: If he has been invited, but he does not perceive that he has, and he visits families beforehand or afterwards without informing an available monk, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.2.4.eng: If he has not been invited, but he perceives that he has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.2.5.eng: If he has not been invited, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.2.6.eng: If he has not been invited, and he does not perceive that he has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.2.eng: if it is an appropriate occasion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.3.eng: if he enters after informing an available monk;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.4.eng: if, when there is no available monk, he enters without informing anyone;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.5.eng: if the road passes someone else’s house;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.6.eng: if the road passes the vicinity of someone else’s house;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.7.eng: if he is going between monasteries;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.8.eng: if he is going to the dwelling place of nuns;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.9.eng: if he is going to the dwelling place of the monastics of another religion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.10.eng: if he is returning to the monastery;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.11.eng: if he is going to the house where he has been invited;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.11.comm: Sp 2.302: Bhattiyagharanti nimantitagharaṁ vā salākabhattādidāyakānaṁ vā gharaṁ, “Bhattiyaghara: the house where he has been invited or the house of donors of a meal drawn by lots, etc.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:6.3.15.eng: The training rule on visiting, the sixth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country in the Banyan Tree Monastery at Kapilavatthu,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mahānāmassa sakkassa bhesajjaṃ ussannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.2.eng: Mahānāma the Sakyan had an abundance of tonics.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.2.comm: “Tonics” renders bhesajja. In the origin story below bhesajja seems to refer to the five standard tonics, and I translate it accordingly. The commentary at Sp 2.306 glosses bhesajja with sappitelādīsu, “Ghee, oil, etc.”, which lends some support to this view. In the actual rule, however, the word paccaya is used, which suggests a broader meaning. See comment to the actual rule below.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.3.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.3.eng: He went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.4.eng: “Sir, I wish to invite the Sangha to ask for tonics for four months.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.6.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, mahānāma, saṅghaṃ catumāsaṃ bhesajjena pavārehī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.7.eng: But the monks were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.8.eng: They then told the Buddha what had happened. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.9.eng: “Monks, I allow you to accept an invitation to ask for tonics for four months.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ parittaṃ bhesajjaṃ viññāpenti. Tatheva mahānāmassa sakkassa bhesajjaṃ ussannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.1.eng: Yet the monks only asked Mahānāma for a small amount of tonics, and so he still had an abundance.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.2.pli: Dutiyampi kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.2.eng: A second time he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.3.pli: “icchāmahaṃ, bhante, saṅghaṃ aparampi catumāsaṃ bhesajjena pavāretun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.3.eng: “Sir, I wish to invite the Sangha to ask for tonics for a further four months.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.5.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, mahānāma, saṅghaṃ aparampi catumāsaṃ bhesajjena pavārehī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.6.eng: Again the monks were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.8.eng: “Monks, I allow you to accept a further invitation.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ parittaṃyeva bhesajjaṃ viññāpenti. Tatheva mahānāmassa sakkassa bhesajjaṃ ussannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.1.eng: Once again the monks only asked Mahānāma for a small amount of tonics, and so he still had an abundance.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.2.pli: Tatiyampi kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.2.eng: A third time he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.3.eng: “Sir, I wish to invite the Sangha to ask for tonics for life.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.5.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, mahānāma, saṅghaṃ yāvajīvaṃ bhesajjena pavārehī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.6.eng: Yet again the monks were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.8.eng: “Monks, I allow you to accept a permanent invitation.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dunnivatthā honti duppārutā anākappasampannā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were shabbily dressed and improper in appearance.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.2.pli: Mahānāmo sakko vattā hoti—“kissa tumhe, bhante, dunnivatthā duppārutā anākappasampannā?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.2.eng: Mahānāma criticized them, “Venerables, why are you shabbily dressed and improper in appearance?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.3.pli: Nanu nāma pabbajitena sunivatthena bhavitabbaṃ supārutena ākappasampannenā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.3.eng: Shouldn’t one who has gone forth be suitably dressed and proper in appearance?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.4.eng: The monks from the group of six developed a grudge against Mahānāma.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.5.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—“kena nu kho mayaṃ upāyena mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ maṅkuṃ kareyyāmā”ti? Atha kho chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.5.eng: Thinking of ways to humiliate him, it occurred to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.6.pli: “mahānāmena kho, āvuso, sakkena saṅgho bhesajjena pavārito. Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ sappiṃ viññāpemā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.6.eng: “Mahānāma has invited the Sangha to ask for tonics. Let’s ask him for ghee.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.7.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū yena mahānāmo sakko tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ etadavocuṃ—“doṇena, āvuso, sappinā attho”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.7.eng: They then went to Mahānāma and said, “We need a doṇa measure of ghee.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.7.comm: According T. W. Rhys Davids in “On the Ancient Coins and Measures of Ceylon: with a discussion of the Ceylon date of the Buddha’s death”, p. 18, one doṇa is equivalent to 64 handfuls. This is perhaps roughly equivalent to one liter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.9.eng: People have gone to the cow-pen to get ghee.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.10.eng: You may come and get it in the morning.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.12.pli: tatiyampi kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ etadavocuṃ—“doṇena, āvuso, sappinā attho”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.12.eng: and a third time the monks from the group of six said the same thing,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.16.pli: “Kiṃ pana tayā, āvuso, adātukāmena pavāritena, yaṃ tvaṃ pavāretvā na desī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.16.eng: They then said, “Why do you give an invitation if you don’t wish to give?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.17.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—“kathañhi nāma bhadantā—‘ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamethā’ti vuccamānā nāgamessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.17.eng: Mahānāma complained and criticized them, “How can they not wait for one day when asked?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.18.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū mahānāmassa sakkassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.18.eng: The monks heard the complaints of Mahānāma,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.19.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.19.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.20.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū mahānāmena sakkena—‘ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamethā’ti vuccamānā nāgamessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.20.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six not wait for one day when asked by Mahānāma?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.21.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, mahānāmena sakkena—‘ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamethā’ti vuccamānā nāgamethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.21.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you acted like this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.24.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, mahānāmena sakkena—“ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamethā”ti vuccamānā nāgamessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.24.eng: “Foolish men, how could you act like this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.26.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.26.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.27.1.pli: “Agilānena bhikkhunā catumāsappaccayapavāraṇā sāditabbā, aññatra punapavāraṇāya, aññatra niccapavāraṇāya; tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.27.1.eng: ‘A monk who is not sick may accept an invitation to ask for requisites for four months. If he accepts one beyond that limit, except if it is a further invitation or a permanent invitation, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.27.1.comm: I render paccaya as “requisites”, not as “tonics”. It might seem from the origin story and the word commentary below that this rule deals with tonics or medicines, bhesajja. The problem with this view, however, is that paccaya, when used alone, never has this meaning in the Vinaya, nor in the four main Nikāyas. When paccaya is used by itself, it invariably means cause, condition, foundation, support, or something to this effect. It only refers to medicines in compounds such as gilāna-ppaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāra, “medicines and requisites to support the sick”, where it is the context that gives it its specific reference. In the present rule there is no such context. The meaning of the word remains “support”. Given that the rules must have existed before the Vibhaṅga, the meaning of the rule is independent of it. We can only conclude that the meaning of paccaya must be “support”, that is, any material requisite that supports the monastic life. See AN 4.79 for the use of paccaya in this sense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.1.eng: A monk who is not sick may accept an invitation to ask for requisites for four months:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.2.eng: he may accept an invitation to ask for requisites for the sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.3.eng: He may also accept a further invitation:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.4.eng: he should think, “I’ll ask when I’m sick.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.5.eng: He may also accept a permanent invitation:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.6.eng: he should think, “I’ll ask when I’m sick.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.7.eng: If he accepts one beyond that limit:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.8.eng: there are invitations that have a limit on the tonics, but no limit on the time period;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.9.eng: there are invitations that have a limit on the time period, but no limit on the tonics;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.10.pli: atthi pavāraṇā bhesajjapariyantā ca rattipariyantā ca,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.10.eng: there are invitations that have a limit on both the tonics and the time period;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.11.pli: atthi pavāraṇā neva bhesajjapariyantā na rattipariyantā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.11.eng: there are invitations that have neither a limit on the tonics nor on the time period.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.13.eng: the tonics are restricted: “I invite you to ask for these particular tonics.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.15.eng: the time period is restricted: “I invite you to ask during this particular period of time.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.16.eng: Limit on both the tonics and the time period:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.17.pli: bhesajjāni ca pariggahitāni honti rattiyo ca pariggahitāyo honti—“ettakehi bhesajjehi ettakāsu rattīsu pavāremī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.17.eng: both the tonics and the time period are restricted: “I invite you to ask for these particular tonics during this particular period of time.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.18.eng: Neither a limit on the tonics nor on the time period:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.19.pli: bhesajjāni ca apariggahitāni honti rattiyo ca apariggahitāyo honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.19.eng: neither the tonics nor the time period is restricted.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.20.pli: Bhesajjapariyante—yehi bhesajjehi pavārito hoti tāni bhesajjāni ṭhapetvā aññāni bhesajjāni viññāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.20.eng: When there is a limit on the tonics, if he asks for tonics other than those he has been invited to ask for, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.21.pli: Rattipariyante—yāsu rattīsu pavārito hoti, tā rattiyo ṭhapetvā aññāsu rattīsu viññāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.21.eng: When there is a limit on the time period, if he asks outside of the period during which he has been invited to ask, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.22.pli: Bhesajjapariyante ca rattipariyante ca—yehi bhesajjehi pavārito hoti, tāni bhesajjāni ṭhapetvā yāsu rattīsu pavārito hoti, tā rattiyo ṭhapetvā aññāni bhesajjāni aññāsu rattīsu viññāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.22.eng: When there is a limit on both the tonics and on the time period, if he asks for tonics other than those he has been invited to ask for or he asks outside of the period during which he has been invited to ask, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.23.eng: When there is neither a limit on the tonics nor on the time period, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.1.pli: Na bhesajjena karaṇīyena bhesajjaṃ viññāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.1.eng: If he asks for tonics when he has no need for tonics, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.2.pli: Aññena bhesajjena karaṇīyena aññaṃ bhesajjaṃ viññāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.2.eng: If he asks for a tonic other than the tonic he needs, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.3.1.pli: Tatuttari tatuttarisaññī bhesajjaṃ viññāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.3.1.eng: If it is beyond the limit, and he perceives it as such, and he asks for tonics, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.4.pli: Tatuttari vematiko bhesajjaṃ viññāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.4.eng: If it is beyond the limit, but he is unsure of it, and he asks for tonics, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.5.pli: Tatuttari natatuttarisaññī bhesajjaṃ viññāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.5.eng: If it is beyond the limit, but he does not perceive it as such, and he asks for tonics, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.6.eng: If it is not beyond the limit, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.7.eng: If it is not beyond the limit, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.8.eng: If it is not beyond the limit, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.2.pli: yehi bhesajjehi pavārito hoti tāni bhesajjāni viññāpeti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.2.eng: if he asks for those tonics for which he was invited to ask;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.3.pli: yāsu rattīsu pavārito hoti tāsu rattīsu viññāpeti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.3.eng: if he asks during the time period for which he was invited to ask;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.4.pli: “imehi tayā bhesajjehi pavāritāmha, amhākañca iminā ca iminā ca bhesajjena attho”ti ācikkhitvā viññāpeti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.4.eng: if he asks by informing, “You have invited me to ask for these tonics, but I need such-and-such a tonic;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.5.pli: “yāsu tayā rattīsu pavāritāmha tāyo ca rattiyo vītivattā amhākañca bhesajjena attho”ti ācikkhitvā viññāpeti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.5.eng: if he asks by informing, “The time period during which you invited me to ask has passed, but I need tonics;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.7.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.8.eng: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.9.eng: if it is by means of his own property;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.11.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.12.eng: The training rule on Mahānāma, the seventh, is finished.
